column4: is there a way to force apt-get to install a certain package even on dependency problems?
i changed from debian/sid to ubuntu in a running system ... i get some dependency problems now .. because of newer packages in debian/sid ...
anybody knows how i can force to install some packages ... or any other way to get rid of this problemes?
apt-get --reinstall install foo/hoary perhaps, if needed
what precisely would you like to do?
this is why people usually say debian and ubuntu repositories should not be mixed
yes i know ... ;( but i did allready ...
yes, not sure what to advise
can i force to remove this packages ... ? to reinstall them from ubuntu ... ?
but how can i remove them?/
for example, sudo dpkg --purge foo, or you can use synaptic
dpkg: dependency problems prevent removal of python2.4 ... ;(
